features.additionalInfo: Adding an additional cardholder is an easy way to share the convenience and accessibility of your CommBank credit card, without opening a new account. You can have one additional cardholder and they must be at least 16 years old. They'll get a card with their name but with your account number.

A balance transfer is when you request an amount owing on a personal Australian-bank issued credit card or store card to be transferred to your Commonwealth Bank credit card. This can help you save on interest charges and enables you to manage your finances in one spot. There is no fee charged to transfer the balance, however, interest will apply from the date of the transfer.

Through AutoPay you can choose to have the full closing balance, minimum amount due or a set amount (assuming it's more than the minimum amount due and less than the full closing balance) directly debited from a CommBank transaction account.
See, track and easily pay your bills online in NetBank or on the go in the CommBank app.
A program available exclusively to Mastercard cardholders that provides access to unforgettable experiences in the cities where you live and travel.
Wherever you are in the world, CommBank gives you the choice and control to securely manage all of your accounts on a range of devices, the way you want.
Pay with your Apple(TM) device using Apple Pay.
Pay with your Android(TM) phone using the CommBank app.
Pay with your Fitbit(TM) smartwatch using Fitbit Pay.
Pay with your Garmin(TM) smartwatch using Garmin Pay.
Pay with your Android(TM) device using Google Pay(TM).
Pay with your Samsung(TM) device using Samsung Pay.
Up to 55 days. We won't charge any interest on purchases if you pay at least the closing balance shown on your statement by the due date each and every month.
Earn bonus points for every dollar you spend on your Awards credit cards when you shop with our bonus partners. The best part is there's no cap on how many bonus points you can earn.
Make the most of Australia's largest credit card rewards program. Source: DBM Consultants, customers 18+ with a rewards/loyalty card in the 12 months to August 2018.

Earn 1 Awards points for every dollar you spend on your Mastercard. Earn up to 60,000 points per year. Earn Bonus Points when you make purchases with your credit card at one of our bonus partners including the Bonus Points eShop. Bonus points do not expire and there is no cap on how many bonus points you can earn each year. The earning and redemption of CommBank Awards points are subject to the Commonwealth (CommBank) Awards Program Terms & Conditions.
Reminders before payments are due to avoid late fees.
Turn Transaction Notifications on in the CommBank app and we'll instantly alert you when you pay using your CommBank credit card, and when you receive money into your everyday account.
Streamline your business banking and save time with automatic data feeds from your online banking to your accounting software.
Instantly lock, block or limit your credit card for extra control through the CommBank app or NetBank.
We help you stay on track with your credit card spending in the CommBank app.
Take control of your credit card repayments and break down a large credit card purchase or balance into fixed monthly instalments over a set term.

constraints.additionalInfo: Note that the credit limit we give you will depend on your ability to meet your repayments.

eligibility.additionalInfo: The additional cardholder may be 16 years of age or older.
Available to citizens or permanent resident of Australia and valid Visa holders. Make sure you are legally allowed to work in Australia.
Available to citizens or permanent resident of NZ and valid Visa holders. Make sure you are legally allowed to work in Australia.
Each application for credit is assessed on the ability of the applicant to service debt (limit) based on the financials supplied in the application.
Applications for credit cards are subject to credit approval.

fees.name: Late payment fee
fees.additionalInfo: When you don't make your minimum monthly payment, plus any overdue amount, by your statement due date.

fees.name: Overlimit fee
fees.additionalInfo: When we first allow you to go over your credit limit in a statement period.

fees.name: Emergency issue/ lost/ replacement card fee
fees.additionalInfo: When you need an emergency replacement card delivered to you.

fees.name: Additional cardholder fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable at the same time as your annual fee if you'd like to share the convenience of your card with someone else.

fees.name: Qantas Frequent Flyer Direct fee
fees.additionalInfo: There is a $30 annual fee charged for opting in. Once a customer has opted in to Qantas Frequent Flyer Direct, all CommBank Awards points earned after opting in will be automatically redeemed for Qantas Points and transferred monthly to their Qantas Frequent Flyer account at the applicable conversion rate.

fees.name: Cash equivalent items or cash substitutes cash advance charge
fees.additionalInfo: Charge applies to purchases of items we consider equivalent to cash, such as gambling, lottery tickets, money transfers or travellers cheques, including transactions which merchants tell us are for such items. 1.5% of the cash advance amount.  A maximum charge of $150.00 applies (or a flat fee of $2.50 if your closing balance on the previous day was in credit).

fees.name: International transaction fee (Mastercard and Visa transactions)
fees.additionalInfo: When you make a transaction that is converted by Mastercard or Visa from a foreign currency to Australian dollars.

fees.name: International transaction fee (Transactions in Australian dollars but with an overseas connection)
fees.additionalInfo: When you make a purchase or obtain a cash advance in Australian dollars while overseas, or while in Australia (for example online) where the merchant, or the financial institution or entity processing the transaction, is located overseas.

fees.name: ATM cash advance charge
fees.additionalInfo: Charge applies to cash advances through a terminal of any financial institution in Australia, at ASB Bank in New Zealand, Commonwealth Bank in Indonesia and Commonwealth Bank in Vietnam. 1.5% of the cash advance amount. A maximum charge of $150.00 applies (or a flat fee of $2.50 if your closing balance on the previous day was in credit).

fees.name: Commonwealth Bank over-the-counter cash advance charge
fees.additionalInfo: Charge applies to cash advances at Commonwealth Bank Branches. $2.50 or 1.5% of the cash advance amount (whichever is greater). A maximum charge of $150.00 applies (or a flat fee of $2.50 if your closing balance on the previous day was in credit).

fees.name: Commonwealth Bank over-the-counter cash advance charge
fees.additionalInfo: Charge applies to cash advances at Commonwealth Bank Branches. $2.50 or 1.5% of the cash advance amount (whichever is greater). A maximum charge of $150.00 applies (or a flat fee of $2.50 if your closing balance on the previous day was in credit).

fees.name: Non-Commonwealth Bank over-the-counter cash advance charge
fees.additionalInfo: Charge applies to cash advance transactions made at other financial institutions within Australia. $3.00 or 1.5% of the cash advance amount (whichever is greater).A maximum charge of $150.00 applies (or a flat fee of $2.50 if your closing balance on the previous day was in credit).

fees.name: Non-Commonwealth Bank over-the-counter cash advance charge
fees.additionalInfo: Charge applies to cash advance transactions made at other financial institutions within Australia. $3.00 or 1.5% of the cash advance amount (whichever is greater).A maximum charge of $150.00 applies (or a flat fee of $2.50 if your closing balance on the previous day was in credit).

fees.name: Any other Commonwealth Bank Network cash advance charge
fees.additionalInfo: Charge applies to cash advances by way of funds transfer through NetBank, CommBiz, Phonebank Transfer, Commonwealth Bank Customer Service Centre, Australia Post, 132221 Transfer Case, NetBank Transfer Home Loan, Mobile Bank Transfer and NetBank Transfer Personal Loan. 1.5% of the cash advance amount. A maximum charge of $150.00 applies (or a flat fee of $2.50 if your closing balance on the previous day was in credit).

fees.name: Overseas terminal or bank cash advance charge
fees.additionalInfo: $4.00 or 1.5% of the cash advance amount(whichever is greater). A maximum charge of $150.00 applies (or a flat fee of $2.50 if your closing balance on the previous day was in credit).

fees.name: Overseas terminal or bank cash advance charge
fees.additionalInfo: $4.00 or 1.5% of the cash advance amount(whichever is greater). A maximum charge of $150.00 applies (or a flat fee of $2.50 if your closing balance on the previous day was in credit).

data.name: Business Awards credit card
data.description: Perfect for those looking for a competitive interest-free period on purchases and to reward themselves for business purchases.
